page.title: 12THE POLITICAL SCENE
page.content: In June of this year local elections where held for the{Ballymena Rural {District Council.}Like all N.Ireland elections the overriding issue was not local, but based on the future of the Province; the{Unionist-Nationalist standpoints and the answer to the present 'troubles'. This area is strongly protestant and has mainly elected candidates who will preserve the Union. { In this election there where 6 seats {in the Maine ward. 5 went to the {Democratic Unionist Party and the {other to an Offical Unionist. The DUP who control the council, were founded and are led by the{Rev.Ian {Paisley}who also leads the Free Pres. Church and is an M.P.for the N.Antrim area at the Westminster and European Parliaments,and N.I.Assembly.The mayor of Ballymena,{Sandy Spence,reps.Maine.
